name: MediumTermNoteIssuanceProgramme
definition: a program of offerings of medium term notes; a set of issues where the maturity is defined after the rest of the terms have been registered with some authority; these are registered up front so that then the company wants to borrow more money they don't have to go through the registration period but have the facility up front to issue another security.
label: medium term note issuance programme

name: BondIssuanceProgramme
label: bond issuance programme
definition: a debt issuance programe under which an entity may, from time to time, issue bonds under the terms and conditions specified in the base prospectus for that programme

name: RefundingPurpose
label: refunding purpose
definition: a procedure whereby an issuer refinances outstanding bonds by issuing new bonds

name: DebtIssuancePurpose
definition: purpose for the issuance of a debt security; also defines processes to be followed in some instances
label: debt issuance purpose

name: PoolBackedSecuritySecuritizationProcessActor
label: pool backed security securitization process actor

name: RetailAssetPoolCreationProcess
label: retail asset pool creation process
definition: The process by which pools of assets are created. These may then be used in the issue of securities based on those asset pools as underlying.

name: UnderwriterTakedownForDebt
definition: information on takedown quantity of the debt security handled by the underwriter (that will be brought into DTC)
label: underwriter takedown for debt

name: BondOffering
label: bond offering
definition: a debt offering of one or more bonds, as all or part of an issuance programme

name: DebtIssuanceProgramme
definition: a series of debt security issuances over time
label: debt issuance programme

name: AdvancedRefunding
label: advance refunding
explanatoryNote: The proceeds are then invested, and when the older bonds become callable they are paid off with the invested proceeds.
definition: refunding in which bond issuance in which new bonds are sold at a lower rate than outstanding ones

name: MuniIssueUnderwriter
definition: The party which agrees to buy any certificates that are not bought by investors Term origin:DTCC
label: muni issue underwriter

name: DebtIssuanceProcessInformation
label: debt issuance process information
definition: information specific to the issuance of a debt security

name: HomeEquityLineOfCreditPoolCreationProcess
label: home equity line of credit pool creation process

name: NewMoneyPurpose
label: new money purpose
definition: securities issued to raise funds for a new project or purpose

name: BondOfferingWithWarrant
definition: a bond offering where the issue includes a warrant; Further notes: ISO 10962 CFI definition is A bond that is issued together with one or more warrant(s) attached as part of the offer, the warrant(s) granting the holder the right to purchase a designated security, often the common stock of the issuer of the debt, at a specified price. Review notes: This need not be any specific type of bond. The warrant is used as a sweetener to encourage people to subscribe to a new bond issue. The Bond and the Warrant trade together as a unit (called "Bond Unit").
label: bond offering with warrant

name: RemarketingPurpose
definition: the process of reselling securities to the public that have been tendered for purchase by the previous owners thereof
label: remarketing purpose

name: IssuanceProcessActivity
definition: An activity within the process of securities issuance.
label: issuance process activity

name: announces
definition: The issue of one or more securities that the announcement pertains to.
label: announces

name: isBankQualified
definition: designation given to a public purpose bond offering by the issuer if it reasonably expects to issue in the calendar year of such offering no more than $10 million par amount of bonds of the type required to be included in making such calculation under the Internal Revenue Code.  When purchased by a commercial bank for its portfolio, the bank may receive an 80% tax deduction for the interest cost of carry for the issue.  A bond that is bank qualified is also known as a qualified tax-exempt obligation.
label: is bank qualified

name: underwriterTakedownAmount
label: underwriter takedown amount
definition: Takedown amount of the security handled by the underwriter(that will be brought into DTC).

name: hasOriginalIssueDiscount
definition: discount from par value at the time a bond or other debt instrument is issued
explanatoryNote: The OID is the difference between the stated redemption price at maturity and the actual issue price.
label: has original issue discount
